intro: Clarkia springvillensis, commonly known as Springvillensis Clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Clarkia springvillensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to mild, moist climates.
